channel.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
channel.description: Hello, I'm new to linux etc... Just installed Whonix gateway to Kali Linux. Noticed that i cant use ping or nmap or openvas my question is can i still "perform" MITM attacks? is there anyway to temporary disable whonix and use my "normal" connection. i mean i dont want configure kali linux each time to use whonix gateway or my "normal" connection Thanks

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas

item.description:
anyway, thanks for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
item.dc:creator: sheep
item.description:
Skullknock:

Noticed that i cant use ping or nmap or openvas

To scan within Whonix use Tor before VPN or use SSH to connect to a VPS and do it from there.

Read full topic
item.source: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Able to sniff packets from the Kali VM? So you’re already passing it through?

Then when listening on the USB, disable the adapter that connects to Whonix Gateway. Maybe your VM is confused about which network to use when you have multiple interfaces attached.

Read full topic
item.source: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
item.dc:creator: Skullknock
item.description:
i have usb adapter, i was able to to sniff packets before whonix installation, That’s my problem

Read full topic
item.source: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
That’s because you need access to the physical adapter you want to sniff traffic on. So your choices are:

*Burn a Kali liveCD and boot it up and sniff from baremetal.
*Buy and passthrough a USB WiFi adapter and use Kali from a VM.
*Passthrough your current Wifi NIC with IOMMU if your hardware supports it, but note that your host will no longer be able to see it in that case until your are done with it and pass it back.

Read full topic
item.source: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Skullknock:

yeah let me “Clarify” MITM means Man In The Middle in my case, i’m studying Communications & Networks(i have my own "lab"which is not illegal )

Glad you cleared that up.

Skullknock:

Today after Whonix installation(i love my privacy that’s why installed whonix) i wasn’t able to “perform” anything used my own tool and kali built-in tool ettercap.

Where is the network you are pentesting? Is it a LAN? Then of course you won’t be able to access it from over Tor which sends stuff out on the internet.

Read full topic

item.title: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
In ping’s case at least it’s using ICMP which Tor does not support.

You can configure the Kali network card to connect to the clearnet via the default NAT connection.

Skullknock:

my question is can i still “perform” MITM attacks?

Careful here. Unless you clarify what MITM means in your case I will have to lock this thread. This is not “baby’s first hax0r course”.

Read full topic
item.source: Help Whonix Gateway ping, nmap, openvas
